comments:
Build ID: M20060921-0945

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Create a very simple ecore model and do not set the EType feature of one of your EClasses
2. Create the genmodel
3. Click Set SDO Defaults
4. Generate Model code

It should really verify the model before the model is generated. A NPE displayed as a warning in the Error Log does not satisfy the user and is hard for new users to find out what happened.


More information:
EMF Version 2.2.1_200609210005

eclipse.buildId=M20060921-0945
java.version=1.4.2_03
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -console -consoleLog -clean

Warning
Thu Dec 07 14:55:45 CET 2006


java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenTypedElementImpl.getTypeGenPackage(GenTypedElementImpl.java:65)
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenPackageImpl$DependencyHelper.<init>(GenPackageImpl.java:1951)
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.impl.GenPackageImpl.prepareCache(GenPackageImpl.java:2705)
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.generator.GenPackageGeneratorAdapter.doPreGenerate(GenPackageGeneratorAdapter.java:136)
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.generator.AbstractGeneratorAdapter.preGenerate(AbstractGeneratorAdapter.java:157)
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.generator.Generator.generate(Generator.java:327)
	at org.eclipse.emf.codegen.ecore.genmodel.presentation.GenModelActionBarContributor$8.execute(GenModelActionBarContributor.java:370)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation$1.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:101)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1737)
	at org.eclipse.ui.actions.WorkspaceModifyOperation.run(WorkspaceModifyOperation.java:113)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Yup, this is one of the many constraints on Ecore validity that we should be checking.

Once we have validation of Ecore, as described in bug 75933, we will be able to properly identify such problems when you save the Ecore file and when you load the generator.


*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 75933 ***
